TEXT.S:
babaledaw / sa lebulebud ku babaledaw i umaumahan.
siwkay nu babaledaw u kulitnu babaledaw a kidusa, u landawayatu makulahay. sapilimet i liwliw , u midiputay a kulit . mukan tu nipaluma' ku babaledaw, sisa mabidangku malukaytu babaledaw. itawya, tuduhenikikennu malukay ku babaledaw, bangsisa'sutu. hali mukan tu niyazu'ay a tademaw.
mibabaledaw / mibabaledaw kaku i umaumahan nacila.
sibabaledawan / sibabaledaw ku umah ni Kacaw.
u sulit nu Amilika Locusts are certain species of short-horned grasshoppers in the family Acrididae that have a swarming phase. These insects are usually solitary, but under certain circumstances, become more abundant and change their behaviour and habits, becoming gregarious. No taxonomic distinction is made between locust and grasshopper species; the basis for the definition is whether a species forms swarms under intermittently suitable conditions.
